instruction: Generate a poem that compares two contrasting ideas.
output:
Two sides of a story all the same
But so swift and diametrically opposed
One looking to the future, making fame
The other rooted in the dark, close

One grows in hope and finds the light
The other entrenched in shadows of woe
One dreams of grand spectacles in sight
The other stunted as life slows

One rides the crest, it's trials and glee
The other battles down it's troubled waters
One paths with glorious gems to see
The other a rocky ruin of tattered walks

Both paths so unlike yet intertwined 
Chasing the same destination of shore
Dreams divided yet inherently entwined
Pulled by the same source evermore.
